intro: Obione acutiloba, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a feature common in the genus. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
